@theasianpianist we need this urgently for https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-swss/pull/2618 to go in. #2618 is needed for pilot testing on chassis.
Why do we want to start building swss-common instead of downloading artifacts?

Let me copy you on the email thread. sonic-swss compilation is failing due to sonic-swss-common package doesn't seem to be latest enough for this to compile. So why do we have such dependency ? and not directly compile to avoid such issues.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

> Why do we want to start building swss-common instead of downloading artifacts?

The build sonic-swss-common is failed in test stage, it blocks the sonic-swss to use the lastest code, and the sonic-swss cannot be built successfully.

> > Why do we want to start building swss-common instead of downloading artifacts?
> 
> The build sonic-swss-common is failed in test stage, it blocks the sonic-swss to use the lastest code, and the sonic-swss cannot be built successfully. It reduces the dependency to wait for the result of another pipeline.

I consider the two aspects as below, any other thoughts? @theasianpianist 
1.  Is the cost to build the sonic-swss-common low. (5min)
2.  Do we want to use the latest sonic-swss-common in sonic-swss?

As per @prsunny, this need to be included for 202205.
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-swss/pull/2648

comments.body: @marian-pritsak @prsunny could you please help to approve?

@Praveen-Brcm can you help review this?
In general I have seen this MAC Flushing handling code got changed so many times I am very concerned with the design itself as it seems to be very buggy in general...  Any chance this handling can be redesigned so it is less buggy?  Have we covered all possible scenarios yet??

> @Praveen-Brcm can you help review this? In general I have seen this MAC Flushing handling code got changed so many times I am very concerned with the design itself as it seems to be very buggy in general... Any chance this handling can be redesigned so it is less buggy? Have we covered all possible scenarios yet??

I believe McLAG and EVPN have different different scenarios where they change type while programming SAI from what is advertised. On top of that we also need to support consolidated flush notifications which leads to lot of cases to handle. For now I have added UT to ensure the cases are covered but I think its better to redesign the entire FDBOrch in the future. There are lot of checks not only in flush path but also in add and mac learn path.
@prsunny can you please help to review/approve?

You may want to clear the STATE_DB tables during swss restart, otherwise it can show an old data

> You may want to clear the STATE_DB tables during swss restart, otherwise it can show an old data

But even if swss restart, the ACL table/rule is still programmed in ASIC, right? So I think we can keep the status in STATE_DB.
There is one scenario I need to handle, that is clear the STATE_DB entries at config_reload. Otherwise there can be stale entries in STATE_DB.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

> > You may want to clear the STATE_DB tables during swss restart, otherwise it can show an old data
> 
> But even if swss restart, the ACL table/rule is still programmed in ASIC, right? So I think we can keep the status in STATE_DB. There is one scenario I need to handle, that is clear the STATE_DB entries at config_reload. Otherwise there can be stale entries in STATE_DB.

I added two functions at aclorch startup to clear the status from STATE_DB. This can address both config reload and swss restart scenarios.
